injuries.shortComment: Williams joined health and safety protocols Thursday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Williams was brought in on a hardship deal and now himself has landed in protocols. The Blazers may have to turn to Jarron Cumberland for backup guard minutes.

injuries.shortComment: Simons entered health and safety protocols Thursday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Simons is in the midst of a career year with averages of 11.9 points, 2.6 rebounds and 2.2 assists in 24.2 minutes. In his absence, there will likely be more backup guard minutes available for Tony Snell, Jarron Cumberland and CJ Elleby.

injuries.shortComment: Zeller (kneecap) was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Sunday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Zeller has been sidelined due to a fractured right patella recently, but he'll now be forced to spend some time away from the team due to the league's COVID-19 protocols. It's not yet clear when he'll be able to return to practice or when he'll be cleared to return from his right patella injury.

injuries.shortComment: Nurkic was placed in the NBA's health and safety protocols Sunday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Portland already had five players in protocols before both Nurkic and Cody Zeller tested positive for the virus Sunday night. The big men figure to miss 7-to-10 days, effectively ruling them out for the entirety of Portland's three-game week ahead, which tips off Monday against Utah.

injuries.shortComment: The Trail Blazers placed Covington in the NBA's COVID-19 health and safety protocols Saturday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: He's one of five Portland players to enter the league protocol since Christmas Eve, joining Dennis Smith, Trendon Watford, Keljin Blevins and Ben McLemore. Unless he tests out of protocol early, Covington will likely miss multiple games, starting with Monday's tilt against the Mavericks.

injuries.shortComment: The Trail Blazers announced Thursday that McCollum's right lung is fully healed after suffering a pneumothorax at the beginning of December.
injuries.longComment: McCollum suffered a collapsed lung during a Dec. 4th contest against the Celtics and has been sidelined since. The star guard has continued to make great strides in his recovery and has now advanced to non-contact drills, increased conditioning and shooting drills. The Trail Blazers press release stated that McCollum will continue with this regime and be re-evaluated next week. Tony Snell, Nassir Little and Ben McLemore are all expected to continue having larger roles during the duration of McCollum's absence.
